In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the implementation of your problem in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(s, ' ')
    result = ""
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line * " $word") > text_width
            result *= "$line\n"
            line = ""
        end
        line *= " $word"
    end
    result *= "$line"
    return result
end
```
This function splits the input string into words and iterates over each word. If adding a new word to the current line would exceed `text_width`, it starts a new line. After processing all words, it appends the remaining line to the result. 

Here is an example of how you can use this function:

```julia
s = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua."
println(wrap_string(s))
```
This will print:

```julia
"Lorem ipsum dolor sit 
amet, consectetur adipiscing 
elit. Sed do eiusmod tempor 
incididunt ut labore et dolore 
magna aliqua."
```
